intro: Galium miltorrhizum var. lutchuense, commonly known as Lutchuan bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces tiny white or pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used in traditional herbal remedies for various ailments.
